00001 /* ATYPE_init.c -- begun 20071015 by BLFoley
00002  * This function initializes an atom type list with several
00003  * commonly-used atom types */
00004 #include <mylib.h>
00005 #include <molecules.h>
00006 //#include "../inc/mylib.h" 
00007 //#include "../inc/molecules.h" 
00008 //#define NUMAT 15 // change this if you add more types
00009 //atype *ATYPE_init();
00010 /* For convenience:
00011         typedef struct {
00012                 int n; // atomic number
00013                 char N[21]; // element name
00014                 char NT[21]; // name for element type
00015                 double m; // mass of element type
00016                 char desc[301]; // brief free-form description field
00017                 int nb; // number of typical bonds for this atom type
00018                 double *bo; // typical bond orders (nb of these)
00019         } atype; // atom types, with other info
00020 */
00021 atype *ATYPE_init(){
00022 atype *A;
00023 
00024 NUMAT=15;
00025 
00026 A=(atype*)calloc(NUMAT,sizeof(atype));
00027 
00028 A[0].n=6;
00029 strcpy(A[0].N,"CG");
00030 strcpy(A[0].NT,"C");
00031 A[0].m=12.011;
00032 strcpy(A[0].desc,"sp3");
00033 A[0].nb=4;
00034 //
00035 A[1].n=6;
00036 strcpy(A[1].N,"CY");
00037 strcpy(A[1].NT,"C");

00039 strcpy(A[1].desc,"sp3");
00040 A[1].nb=4;
